title: Increases the safety of elevators in buildings owned by the New York city housing authority
summary: Increases the safety of elevators in buildings owned by the New York city housing authority by requiring door zone restrictors, stricter inspections, sharing of information regarding elevator safety to the department of buildings and fire department, as well as to the public.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         3513

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   January 25, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of A. KAVANAGH, ROSENTHAL, MILLMAN, O'DONNELL, MENG,
         GIBSON, WEINSTEIN -- Multi-Sponsored by -- M. of A. GOTTFRIED, PHEFFER
         -- read once and referred to the Committee on Cities

       AN ACT to amend the administrative code of the  city  of  New  York,  in
         relation to the safety of elevators in buildings owned by the New York
         city housing authority

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. The administrative code of the city of New York is  amended
    2  by   adding  four  new  sections  28-304.10,  28-304.11,  28-304.12  and
    3  28-304.13 to read as follows:
    4    S 28-304.10 DOOR ZONE RESTRICTORS. IN ANY BUILDING OWNED  BY  THE  NEW
    5  YORK  CITY  HOUSING  AUTHORITY,  ALL  ELEVATORS  SHALL  HAVE A DOOR ZONE
    6  RESTRICTOR WHICH PREVENTS THE ELEVATOR DOOR FROM OPENING MORE THAN  FOUR
    7  INCHES WIDE WHEN THE ELEVATOR STOPS BETWEEN FLOORS.
    8    S 28-304.11 BUILDING INSPECTION OF ELEVATORS. IN ANY BUILDING OWNED BY
    9  THE NEW YORK CITY HOUSING AUTHORITY, ALL ELEVATORS SHALL BE INSPECTED BY
   10  THE DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS IN ACCORDANCE WITH THIS ARTICLE.
   11    S  28-304.12  INTERAGENCY  COORDINATION.  THE  NEW  YORK  CITY HOUSING
   12  AUTHORITY  SHALL  COMMUNICATE  INFORMATION  REGARDING  ELEVATOR  SAFETY,
   13  INCLUDING,  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO,  INFORMATION  PERTAINING  TO ELEVATOR
   14  HAZARDS AND THE NUMBER OF TIMES FIREFIGHTERS HAVE BEEN CALLED TO  RESCUE
   15  PASSENGERS  IN  ELEVATORS, WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS AND THE FIRE
   16  DEPARTMENT OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY OF PASSENGERS.
   17    S 28-304.13 PUBLIC DISCLOSURE OF INSPECTION DATA. THE  NEW  YORK  CITY
   18  HOUSING  AUTHORITY  AND THE DEPARTMENT OF BUILDINGS SHALL PROVIDE TO THE
   19  PUBLIC DETAILED REPORTS REGARDING THE RESULTS OF ELEVATOR INSPECTIONS IN
   20  BUILDINGS OWNED BY THE NEW YORK CITY  HOUSING  AUTHORITY.  SUCH  REPORTS
   21  SHALL  PROVIDE A DETAILED EXPLANATION OF HOW THE ELEVATOR WAS GRADED AND
   22  WHY AN ELEVATOR RECEIVED AN UNSATISFACTORY OR LOW GRADE.
   23    S 2. This act shall take effect on the one hundred eightieth day after
   24  it shall have become a law.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
